It lies not in our power to love or hate: For will in us is over-rul'd by fate.
hen two are stript long ere the course begin
We wish that one should lose
And one especially do we affect
The reason no man knows; let it suffice
What we behold is censur'd by our eyes.

column2: that lov'd not at first sight.

It lies not in our power to love or hate: And in this sweet and curious harmony
The God that tunes this music to our souls
Holds out his hand in highest majesty
Then let some holy trance convey my thoughts
Up to the palace of th'imperial heaven:
That this my life may be as short to me
As are the days of sweet Zenocrate.
